clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating ReFacto AF in Severe Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study to Characterize the Safety and Efficacy of BDDrFVIII Manufactured by the Albumin Free Process (ReFacto AF) in the Treatment of Previously Treated Patients (PTP) With Severe Hemophilia A

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: To characterize the safety and efficacy of ReFacto AF in treating acute bleeding episodes during prophylaxis treatment, including neoantigenicity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe hemophilia A (FVIII:C less than or equal to 2% at local laboratory)
- Previously treated patients with greater than or equal to 250 exposure days to any Factor VIII product
- Age greater than or equal to 12 years
- History of prophylaxis dosing at least twice per week on any Factor VIII product for at least 3 consecutive months within the 2 years prior to study enrollment unless the patient completed the previous pharmacokinetic study
- Adequate laboratory results
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any bleeding disorder in addition to hemophilia A
- Concomitant therapy with immunosuppressive drugs
- Current or historical Factor VIII inhibitor
- Treatment with any investigational drug or device within the past 30 days
